basics.name: Joel Curtis Nicolow
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaiʻi. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2024.

interests.name: Data Science applications in the climate sciences

work.company: Hawaiʻi Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research (EPSCoR) Change(HI)

work.summary: Introductory Remote Sensing Specialist at the Climate Resilience Collabrative in SOEST. Working with APIs and geospatial data in Python 3 including contour extraction and the use of machine learning toolkits for pixel classification.

work.company: CyberInfrastructure TRaining for Undergraduates in Summer (CITRUS)
work.summary: One-month program developing key skills and abilities in CyberInfrastructure (CI) with a climate-focused research project applying CI skills. Skills developed in data science, analytics, and visualization.

work.company: University of Hawaiʻi - Thompson School of Social Work & Public Health
work.summary: Created R data frameworks to handle record-level health data
